result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Belfeuil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to huber privileges and good time credit.   Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

**The Court sua sponte increases the total amount ordered to cover the mandatory fine/costs.** Fine to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J. Belfeuil

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:09 p.m. Defendant David J. Belfeuil in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to OWI 1st Causing Injury contrary to Wis Stat 346.63(2)(a)1.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15TR2485 - Dismissed outright. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. No statement by DE. Court orders: 70 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than March 15, 2016, $811 fine inclusive of costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, 12 month DL revocation/12 month IID, OWI Assessment. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant David J. Belfeuil in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 10:05 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant David J. Belfeuil in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will be represented by SPD. Atty Szilagyi requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 03:05 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the method of operation.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

ADDRESS INFO for David J. Belfeuil
Current: W4726 Chicago Dr, Redgranite, WI 54970 United States  (Effective: 10-20-2015)
Prior: W6820 S Silver Lake Rd, Wautoma, WI 54982

15CM-360 and 15TR-2485 - Both Cases Called @  3:07 PM: Defendant David J. Belfeuil in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint/Citation Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - cannot afford his own counsel - currently not employed.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility.   NGP entered by Court as to both matters.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
